Celebrated diversely across India, this auspicious day reminds devotees that righteousness and courage always prevail, inspiring hope and devotion.

Police stated the duo was planning to target a social media influencer, having conducted reconnaissance in Mumbai and Bengaluru. Firearms were seized.

One jet, Delta Flight 5047, was taxiing after landing from Charlotte when the incident happened.

Authorities halted supplies from Kayson Pharma, advising against its administration to children under five.

title: Popular freeze-dried chocolate snacks recalled as they may cause ‘traumatic injury’
description: A popular brand of chocolate-covered fruit snack products sold nationwide in the United States have been recalled due to potential metal contamination. It could cause traumatic injury. "Hard or sharp foreign objects in food may cause traumatic injury including laceration and perforation of tissues of the mouth, tongue, throat, stomach and intestine as well as damage to the teeth and gums," the FDA cautioned. Consumers are advised to discard affected items, identifiable by manufacturing codes on the packaging, and can seek a refund. No injuries have been reported as of September 26.

title: Asia Cup | 'India are No. 1, but their actions are third-rate': Ex-Pak cricketer
description: India boycotted the Asia Cup 2025 trophy presentation, refusing to accept it from PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi. Naqvi reportedly departed with the trophy, leaving India to celebrate without it. Former Pakistani cricketer Basit Ali criticized India's "third-rate" actions, supporting Naqvi. India's captain emphasized their championship status mattered more than the physical trophy, adding new tension to India-Pakistan cricket relations.

title: Bigg Boss 19's Awez Darbar reacts to rumours of paying Rs 2 crore penalty
description: Evicted Bigg Boss 19 contestant Awez Darbar refuted claims of paying a Rs 2 crore penalty to exit, stating he genuinely loves reality shows and wouldn't leave voluntarily. He expressed disappointment over his eviction, questioning the makers' timing and his vote count despite trending high. Darbar also shared how the show toughened his personality.

description: Indian cricketer Abhishek Sharma showcased his dancing skills alongside Yuvraj Singh and singer Ranjit Bawa at his sister Komal's pre-wedding function in Ludhiana. This celebration follows Sharma's recent triumph as Player of the Tournament in the Asia Cup 2025, where he scored 314 runs, including three consecutive half-centuries, and received a car for his exceptional performance.

title: 'Kantara Chapter 1': Rishab Shetty called master storyteller on X; climax awestruck
description: Fans have taken to Twitter in droves to laud Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara Chapter 1,' declaring its climax not just unforgettable but a stirring emotional experience. This film, described by many as a testament to 'pure cinema,' invites viewers on a deeply resonant journey.

title: RBI expands credit for companies; limits on loans against shares hiked 5x
description: The Reserve Bank of India introduced major reforms, allowing banks to finance mergers, acquisitions, and IPOs more freely. It raised limits on loans against shares and debt securities, easing borrowing rules for large companies. These changes, effective October 2025, aim to expand credit access, improve liquidity, and deepen capital market participation, complementing government reforms.

title: Fight with Kohli? Dhawan breaks silence: 'I abused a lot'
description: Shikhar Dhawan recently disclosed past conflicts with Virat Kohli, including a shoulder-tackling incident during warm-ups and a heated run-out that coincided with Dhawan's IPL auction disappointment. He also reflected on Kohli's early focus and increased seriousness after his father's passing. These revelations highlight their competitive dynamic and enduring professional relationship.

title: Asia Cup debacle: Afridi warns PCB chief Naqvi - 'It would be a big decision'
description: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi advised Mohsin Naqvi to relinquish either his PCB chairmanship or Interior Ministry role, stressing Pakistan cricket's critical need for undivided focus. Afridi noted Naqvi's multiple high-profile positions, which he believes hinder dedicated attention to the sport, especially following the team's poor showings in the 2025 Champions Trophy and Asia Cup.

title: Feud over compensation in Olympian’s family: Two brothers ‘assault’ his wife, booked
FIFA pushes back on Trump comments about moving World Cup games from ‘dangerous’ cities
description: The 11 U.S. host cities, plus three in Mexico and two in Canada, are contracted with FIFA which would face significant logistical and legal issues to make changes in the eight months before the June 11 kickoff.

description: It will also be closely watched as to who presents the toss in Colombo, with expectations that it would be a former player or pundit from a neutral nation.

Putin likely to visit India: First visit since Ukraine war; ties review expected
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is anticipated to visit India in early December for the 23rd annual summit, marking his first trip since the Ukraine conflict began. Diplomatic sources suggest December 5-6 for the crucial meeting. This visit aims to review bilateral ties in trade, energy, and defence manufacturing, as India navigates its energy relationship with Moscow.

description: Two prime accused in the Zubeen Garg death probe, Shyamkanu Mahanta and Siddharth Sharma, were arrested in Delhi and remanded to 14-day police custody in Guwahati. Charged with culpable homicide and negligence, their apprehension followed Interpol notices. Garg's widow expressed relief, hoping for answers regarding his final moments in Singapore, as public demand for justice intensifies.

title: Malegaon case: 19 years on, charges framed against 4; hearing on Oct 29
description: A special court framed charges against four accused in the 2006 Malegaon blasts case. Lokesh Sharma, Dhan Singh, Rajendra Chaudhary, and Manohar Narwaria pleaded not guilty to murder and terror charges. Earlier, nine Muslim men were discharged after being proved innocent. The NIA took over the investigation and arrested the current accused. The trial will begin on October 29.

title: Release of coin, stamp on RSS insult to Constitution: CPI(M)
description: CPI(M) said the entire exercise is to "whitewash the shameful role of the RSS" which was not just distant from the freedom struggle but actually strengthened the British strategy of divide and rule.

Assam: Govt okays widening of section of NH-715 to 4 lanes; to cost Rs 6.9K cr
description: The Cabinet approved a Rs 6,957 crore project to widen and improve the 86-km Kalibor-Numaligarh section of NH-715 in Assam, including 34.5 km of elevated sections through Kaziranga National Park. This initiative aims to eliminate human-animal conflict by abandoning the existing highway, allowing unhindered animal movement and boosting tourism while ensuring wildlife safety.

title: 'Country’s misfortune': Congress attacks RSS; claims Sangh sided with British
Sangh centenary: PM underlines RSS fight against caste bias; flags illegal immigration
description: PM Modi lauded the RSS's continuous fight against caste discrimination and untouchability, citing its chiefs' calls for shared public spaces. He defended the Sangh against 'Brahmanical outfit' claims and highlighted its historical involvement in the freedom struggle and post-independence movements. Modi also reiterated his strong warning about illegal immigration posing a significant threat to India's demography and internal security.

title: Sangh @100: RSS custodian of India’s civilisational philosophy, says Hosabale
description: RSS leaders celebrated the government's release of a commemorative stamp and coin, marking the Sangh's century-long journey and its recognition as a mainstream force. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh highlighted RSS's role in communal harmony, citing its assistance during the 1984 anti-Sikh riots and its respectful relationship with Mahatma Gandhi despite differences.

title: ‘Classic case of blind faith’: HC jails man for killing wife; nixes his 1984 acquittal
description: After a 43-year legal battle, the Allahabad High Court convicted an elderly man and an accomplice for strangling his wife in 1982. Overturning a 1984 acquittal, Awadhesh Kumar and Mata Prasad received life imprisonment for murder, masked as a ghost exorcism. The court condemned this shocking case of blind faith, also imposing fines and three-year sentences for destroying evidence.

21-yr-old YouTube-trained hacker ran piracy syndicate; $100K crypto seized
description: A 21-year-old Patna college dropout, Ashwani Kumar, emerged as a central figure in India's movie piracy network. Using self-taught hacking skills, he breached digital cinema distributors, downloading over 120 unreleased films. Telangana police arrested him, seizing HD prints and freezing $100,000 in crypto. His sophisticated operation, learned from YouTube, exposed major industry cybersecurity flaws, serving as a critical wake-up call.

title: 'Tariffs to help farmers': Trump announces meet with China's Xi; US soybeans in focus
description: Donald Trump announced plans to use tariff revenue to aid American soybean farmers, who are suffering because China has halted purchases for "negotiating" reasons. He criticized Joe Biden for not enforcing a trade agreement and vowed to address the issue with Xi Jinping, as China now buys from Brazil and Argentina.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says these jobs will see boom as data centers expand
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang forecasts a massive surge in demand for electricians, plumbers, and carpenters to construct data centers, highlighting six-figure salaries often without college degrees. BlackRock's Larry Fink and Ford's Jim Farley also warn of critical labor shortages, fearing these could impede AI infrastructure development and reshoring goals, urging focus on these essential skilled trades.

title: US shutdown: Will it mess with travel plans? Travellers should spare extra time
description: The US government shutdown has begun, creating uncertainty for immigration processes. While USCIS and most Department of State visa/passport services remain operational, the Department of Labor's Office of Foreign Labor Certification has ceased all functions. This halt prevents the filing of crucial LCAs and PERM applications, significantly delaying H-1B and green card processes until the shutdown concludes.

title: US government shutdown: The impact on America’s workforce - explained in numbers
description: The US federal government shut down after President Trump and Congress failed to agree on a spending bill, leaving hundreds of thousands of federal workers furloughed without pay. Essential personnel, including military and air traffic controllers, will continue working unpaid, as deep partisan divides in the Senate prevented any funding agreement from passing.

title: Congress did protest Rahul death threat, CPI(M) ministers 'mistaken': LoP Satheesan

title: Women’s ODI World Cup: Amanjot Kaur makes her presence felt on her comeback to Indian team

title: NCRB report: 10,786 suicides in farm sector in 2023 - Maharashtra tops list
US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; says X account won’t be updated until…
description: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years, as Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. This lapse halts "non-essential" functions like visa services and national parks, while essential employees work without pay. The US Embassy in India also announced reduced updates to its X account.

title: 'Doesn’t have gear': Sean Avery questions Auston Matthews’ ability to lead Maple Leafs
description: Auston Matthews, after an injury-plagued season, faces renewed scrutiny following the Maple Leafs' preseason losses. Former NHL player Sean Avery publicly questioned Matthews' championship potential. This comes despite GM Brad Treliving recently commending Matthews' early preparation and dedication to his craft.

title: Klay Thompson stays silent on Megan Thee Stallion, eyes Mavericks goal
description: Dallas Mavericks' Klay Thompson targets a historic 50/40/90 shooting season, an elite benchmark, after deflecting personal questions at media day. His ambitious individual goal, combined with Kyrie Irving's crucial return from a torn ACL, is pivotal for the Mavericks' playoff aspirations in a highly competitive Western Conference. The team's success hinges on these key performances.
